tours.name: 4 Days Ho Chi Minh - Cu Chi Tunnel - Mekong Delta
tours.description: Discover the vibrant South Vietnam in 4 days. Explore Ho Chi Minh City's historical sites, venture into the Cu Chi Tunnels, and cruise through the beautiful Mekong Delta with its floating markets and traditional villages.

itinerary.title: Ho Chi Minh Arrival
itinerary.content:
Check in accommodation
Free and easy time for exploring

itinerary.title: Saigon City Tour – Cu Chi Tunnel
itinerary.content:
08:00 – 08:30: After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, start your day by exploring the vibrant city of Saigon and its most famous attractions:
War Remnants Museum – Discover historical exhibits from the First Indochina War and the Vietnam War.
Reunification Palace – A remarkable national monument where many significant historical events took place, including the Liberation of the South and the reunification of Vietnam on April 30, 1975.
Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica of Saigon – Built between 1863 and 1880 by French colonists, this iconic church is one of the city's most beautiful landmarks.
Saigon Central Post Office – A striking architectural gem from the late 19th century, designed during the French colonial era, located right next to the Notre Dame Cathedral.
12:00: Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant and take a short rest.
13:00: Depart for Cu Chi Tunnels – an incredible underground network used during the Vietnam War.
Watch a short documentary about Cu Chi during the war.
Experience walking through parts of the tunnel system.
Taste the traditional dish tapioca and enjoy pandan leaf tea.
Try rifle shooting (optional, with an additional charge).
19:00: Return to your hotel in Ho Chi Minh City. Free time to relax or explore the city at your own pace in the evening.

itinerary.title: Mekong Delta
itinerary.content:
07h30: After hotel breakfast, you will be taken to My Tho wharf, the motorboat takes you on the Tien River, pass by floating fish farm villages, and the RACH MIEU bridge a cable stayed bridge spanning the Tien River and linking the two provinces of Tien Giang (My Tho) and Ben Tre together, and four islands: Long, Lan, Qui, Phung. Stop by Con Lan (Unicorn Island) to visit the local honeybee farm and taste the unique honey tea.

After that, the electric cart will escort you to the fruit garden where you can try out the fresh tropical fruits(seasonal) and listen to traditional Southern music. Next, experience the taste of the Mekong Delta when sitting on a rowing boat, weaving into the small canal, watching rows of water coconuts, and the simple landscape of the Mekong Delta.
Returning to the big boat, along the Tien River, the motorboat will take you to the province of Ben Tre, which is known as the "Vietnamese coconut island" to visit the specialty of Ben Tre's coconut candy oven.
12h00: Take a motorboat to the restaurant to have lunch with typical dishes of the Mekong Delta. Rest and bike around the village (optional).
14h00: The motorboat takes you back to My Tho wharf. On the way back, visit Vinh Trang Pagoda, known as "the largest temple in Tien Giang"
18h00: Tour ends. Return to Saigon hotel and you have free time for the rest of the evening

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.content:
Hotel Breakfast
Check out from the hotel and board your transfer to the airport

itinerary.title: Saigon Cruise
itinerary.content:
17:30:
Pick up guests from the hotel and transfer to the pier.
18:00 – 18:30:
Board the cruise and receive a warm welcome from the crew with a refreshing welcome drink. Enjoy the cool evening breeze as the boat begins its journey along the Saigon River.
19:00 – 20:30:
Savor a delicious Vietnamese dinner on board while admiring the sparkling skyline of Ho Chi Minh City. The cruise offers stunning views of landmark buildings, illuminated bridges, and the lively riverside atmosphere. Enjoy live music or traditional dance performances (depending on the cruise program).

20:30 – 21:00:
Relax on the deck, take photos, or simply enjoy the romantic ambiance of Saigon at night.
21:30: The cruise returns to the pier. Guests will be transferred back to the hotel.

itinerary.title: Vung Tau 1 day tour
itinerary.content:
7.45 am, We will pick you up at your hotel in the city center to Vung Tau.
Arriving in Vung Tau and enjoying free time at Thuy Van beach – one of the nicest beaches in Vietnam with the shore runs for almost 10km, full with fine sands and white waves.then, we have authentic Vietnamese lunch at a local restaurant.
After lunch, we visited the Jesus Christ Statue by walking up the 847 stairs and meeting the 32 meter-tall (105 feet) statue of Jesus Christ. Considered one of the tallest statues of Christ in Asia, its outstretched arms span a little over 18.4 meters. Originally started in 1972 but the construction was only completed in 1993. The adventurous are welcome to climb to the top of inside Christ' arms and enjoy the breathtaking panoramic view of Vung Tau city.
The second destination is Thang Tam Temple (Whale Temple). The temple displays the bones which came to symbolize the protector deity of the coast. Now, each time a carcass of a whale washes ashore, the bones are ceremonially hauled to the mausoleum.
We also discover Vung Tau's nicest colonial era mansion – Bach Dinh. It was built as a retreat for French Governor of Indochina Paul Doumer at the beginning of the 20th century.
Cape Nghinh Phong is the final sight before we leave this beautiful coastal city. The Cape is the cliff of Vung Tau and has unobstructed views of  Vung Tau City.
We leave Vung Tau for Saigon. We will have a short break at Long Thanh rest stop for specialty and souvenirs. We will arrive back in the city at about 7:30pm. end services on arrival.
